newsitem.title: USA: U.S corp junk sector ends off, Harvard debt tumbles.
newsitem.headline: U.S corp junk sector ends off, Harvard debt tumbles.

text.p: The corporate bond high-yield sector ended a busy trading day off 1/4 to 1/2 point with Harvard Industries suffering the steepest loss, as its bonds tumbled 10 points, high-yield traders said.
Market players said Harvard bonds tumbled across the board on rumors, later denied, that the firm's efforts to sell its unit, Harman Automotive, had unraveled.
The company's 11-1/8's of 2005 were quoted off 10 points at 47 bid, 50 offer, traders said. The company's 12 percent bonds fell 10 points as well, they said.
"We are still trying to put together a deal that the (buyer) can get financing for," said Richard Dawson, Harvard's senior vice president for law and administration.
Dawson said Harvard was still working with Salomon Brothers to complete the sale of its unit for $18 million to an undisclosed buyer.

Speculation that the deal had fallen through began when word circulated that a Salomon analyst - who was believed to have been prohibited from discussing the deal -- started talking to investors about Harvard, market sources said.
